summary:
I am a well rounded person and professional who strives for excellence. As a professional I like to get into a problem and thoroughly look into the law and its backgrounds. Though my focus is the law I do not lose touch with social- and economic aspects of the problem at hand. This combination aids me in finding creative and well argued solutions. I have strong writing and verbal skills.

Both as a person and professional I like to travel and compare. I am no stranger to foreign cultures and new ideas. This makes me creative and find solutions in ways other people cannot. In groups I take initiative and safe guard progress. In individual setting I work well independently but am not shy to ask for help when needed.

education.field_of_study: Jurisprudence Private law & Constitutional- and Administrative law (120 ECTS)

awards.title: Paddy Moriarty Memorial Scholarship
awards.description:
I received this award as PhD Candidate in 2021 for my contributions to the academic community. As part of my involvement with the Dublin Law and Politics Review and my publications and conference participation. It is a great honor to have been awarded this memorial scholarship. 

The Paddy Moriarty Memorial Chair & Scholarship were established in the School of Law & Government at DCU in 2001. Paddy Moriarty was a distinguished public servant who became Chief Executive of the ESB in 1981 and Chairman in 1991, and was instrumental in developing the ESB during a critical era of growth and expansion in the Irish economy. Amongst other appointments, Paddy also chaired the RTE Authority and the National College of Industrial Relations from 1991 until his untimely death in 1997.

awards.title: Global Young Leadership Certificate of Appreciation
awards.description: This award was given to me by IDE Indonesia as a recognition of young leadership.

awards.title: Outreaching Honours Programme
awards.description:
The Outreaching Honours Programme is an addition to the bacholor programme. It contains of several components that include both acedamic and practical skills. These components are:
 * organizing masterclasses
 * following masterclasses
 * participating in the organization
 * study trip abroad
 * research groups in which we generate and execute our own research
 * two internships - domestic and abroad
 * participating in an organization at board level that gives back to society

awards.title: Topklas
awards.description:
An honours programme for the legal studies. In this programme we followed courses and concluded with a in depth research paper. The courses included:
 * law and biology
 * democratic systems (under pressure)
 * law and sports
 * law and environment
 * finance law
 * victimology
 * methodology of legal research

awards.title: Victoria International Leadership Program
awards.description:
The VILP is an extra curricular program for students with an international focus. Activities include:
 * lecturers outside the scope of the curriculum
 * master classes outside the curriculum
 * fulfilling a leadership role
 * international orientation
 * social gatherings

contributors.headline: Executive Director, Innovation, Enterprise and Engagement at SSE

projects.title: Comparative research into Trust law
projects.description: Comparative research about the social and legal desirability to introduce the New Zealand trust into the Dutch legal system. Using both secondary sources as conducting interviews and gathering empirical data.

projects.title: Research & Masterclass Pension funds
projects.description:
In a small group we conducted research into the level of awareness amongst adolescents of the problems on pension funds. We also investigated if the education systems should incorporate in giving more education on these type of social problems.
As a group we went to high schools to explain the pension fund situation and discussed its effects with  high school students.
We organized a symposium in which our group results were presented. In addition we invited two guest lecturers. The first a manager at ABP who spoke about the discussion of these problems from the viewpoint of the major pension funds. The second guest speaker was a local politician who spoke about the attempts to involve adolescents in these discussions.

projects.title: Research 'Implementing technology in home care organisations'.
projects.description:
Research in cooperation with Nivel about the problems home care organisations experience when implementing technology. Focus on the role of employees in blocking or supporting a technology at two home care institutions.

Methodology: 
Qualitative research - Interviews with care team managers, caregivers, board of directors and manager domotica care / manager innovation. Comparing the strategies, successes and problems implementing care on distance with Ipad's or Pal4 systems at two home care organizations. Also interviews with the end users of these technologies.

profile_positions.description: Assistant Professor focussing on constitutional and adminstrative law related to financial systems in Europe and the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: My role in this network is to coordinate all the activities of the Dublin Law and Politics Review. Under my management the Review has grown into a multinational network, organizing various activities each month. These activities include; research conferences, seminars, workshops and more. Furthermore I am responsible for the journal publication. This includes coordinating a team of editors, reaching out to potential authors and producing a final version of the review.
profile_positions.title: Chairperson

profile_positions.description:
As editor in chief I was responsible for managing the journal's day to day activities and setting out its overall strategy. Under my supervision the journal published its first issue and launched a conference on sustainable finance. Additionally I set up the structure that is now in place for the journal.
In conducting the running of the journal I was assisted by content and language editors.
profile_positions.title: Editor In Chief

profile_positions.description: As a member of the steering committee, I was co-responsible for inviting keynote speakers, finding sponsorships keeping the budget and other general management tasks such as drafting the general programma etc.

profile_positions.description: As committee member of PGS I was responsible for organizing several social events for the DCU society such as board game nights, movie nights and hikes. This included the practical organization as well as promotion for the events.
